questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true regarding the clavicle?

options.label: A
options.text: Its medial end is enlarged where it attaches to the sternum.

options.label: B
options.text: Its lateral end is flat where it articulates with the humerus.

options.label: C
options.text: The clavicle transmits shock from the upper limb to the axial skeleton.

options.label: D
options.text: The clavicle is a “long bone” that has no medullary cavity.

questions.correct_answer: B. Its lateral end is flat where it articulates with the humerus.

questions.text: The first part of the duodenum is located at which of the following vertebral levels?

Assertion (A): The left superior vena cava drains into the right atrium by way of the left sinus horn, that is, the coronary sinus. Reason (R) : Left superior vena cava is caused by persistence of the left anterior cardinal vein and obliteration of the common cardinal and proximal part of the anterior cardinal veins on the right. In such a case, blood from the right is channelled toward the left by way of the brachiocephalic vein.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true and R is NOT correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true R is false

options.label: D
options.text: R is true A is false

questions.correct_answer: A. Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation of A

questions.text: A 50-year-old female presents with chronic upper GI complaints. Upper GI endoscopy shows proliferating mass in the stomach and she was eventually diagnosed to have gastric carcinoma. During sugery, before approaching the stomach, lesser omentum is seen. Free edge of lesser omentum formed by:

Which of the following statement is true regarding “Cyanide” ?

options.label: A
options.text: Only minimally inhibits the ETC because cytochrome oxidase is the terminal component of the chain

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibits mitochondrial respiration but energy production is unaffected

options.label: C
options.text: Also binds the copper of cytochrome oxidase

options.label: D
options.text: Bind to Fe+++ of cytochrome a3

questions.correct_answer: D. Bind to Fe+++ of cytochrome a3

A 65-year-old woman is brought to emergency after an automobile accident in which severe lacerations to the right wrist severed a major muscle tendon. The severed ends of the tendon was overlapped by 6 mm to facilitate suturing and reattachment. Which of the following would be expected after 3 weeks compared with the pre-injured muscle? Assume that series growth of sarcomeres cannot be completed within 3 weeks.

Shown below are the response of a hormone to a meal and insulin-induced hypoglycemia. The hormone is most likely to be which of the following?

Regional variations in ventilation (V) and perfusion (Q) are measured in healthy individuals when they stand in the upright position. The results are graphed with x-axis denoting the position along the lung from the base to the apex. Which of the curves is most likely to be observed?

An affected male does not have affected children but an affected female always has affected children. What is the type of inheritance?

A 49-year-old man has had increasing malaise for the past 5 weeks. On physical examination he has a blood pressure of 150/95 mm Hg and 1+ pitting edema of the lower extremities to the knees. Dipstick urinalysis shows no glucose, blood, ketones, nitrite, or urobilinogen, and the microscopic urinalysis reveals no RBC/hpf and only 1 WBC/hpf. Additional laboratory studies show a 24 hour urine protein of 4.1 gm. Light microscopy shows diffuse thickening of glomerular capillary wall and there is no rupture of basement membrane. Electron microscopy show deposits of electron dense immune complexes with intervening delicate projections of basement membrane. His hepatitis B surface antigen is positive. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 9 year old child presents with hypoalbuminemia, edema, hyperlipidemia, and proteinuria. The edema is in the periorbital region initially and eventually spreads to the rest of the body. The patient is given steroid therapy and the disease goes away. What is a key morphological feature of the patients disease?

options.label: D
options.text: Hemosiderin laden macrophages in the kidney

questions.correct_answer: A. Fusion of the foot processes

C3 levels are low and examination of the basement membrane reveals thickening of the glomerular loop or tram-tracking. options.label: C

options.label: A
options.text: Margination-----Stable adhesion-----Activation of integrins-----migration via endothelium.

options.label: C
options.text: Stable adhesion----- Rolling----- Activation of integrins-----migration via endothelium.

options.label: D
options.text: Activation of integrins----- migration via endothelium-----Stable adhesion-----Rolling.

questions.correct_answer: B. Margination-----Transient adhesion-----Stable adhesion-----migration via endothelium.

questions.correct_answer: D. Hyper acute graft rejection is example of type III hypersensitivity reaction.

questions.text: All are constituents of the management of Juvenile papilloma of larynx except

A 34 year old patient came to your OPD with rapid onset of unilateral pain, photophobia, redness and watering from eyes. He was HLAB27 positive. Which of the following is not expected to be seen on slit lamp examination?

A worker presented with sudden onset of vision loss with pain and redness after an explosion in metal industry where he works. On examination, the doctor noted vision to be only Perception of light present. There was scleral perforation in nasal part of eye with uveal tissue show. What is not done in such a scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate X-ray to know any intraocular foreign body (IOFB)

options.label: B
options.text: OCT (Optical Coherence Tomography) to know retinal pathology

options.label: C
options.text: Urgent perforation repair with removal of IOFB

options.label: D
options.text: Prophylactic systemic antibiotics can be given

questions.correct_answer: B. OCT (Optical Coherence Tomography) to know retinal pathology

options.label: A
options.text: Send blood for tests start iv glucose and send to CT

options.label: B

questions.text: A 65 – years old male adult presents with chronic sinusitis, nasopharyngeal ulcers, cavitatory lung nodules and renal failure. What will be the appropriate next diagnostic step?

options.label: B
options.text: Sputum AFB and PCR for TB

questions.correct_answer: C. ANCA and Evaluation for vasculitis

questions.text: A 21- years – old male patients presented with a history of back pain, which is more in the morning and relieved by bathing in warm water. What will be the likely additional finding present in the patient? A. HLA B27 B. Distal Inter Phalangeal joint involvement C. Pleural nodules D. Decreased chest wall expansion

A 32-year-old otherwise healthy female presents to the emergency department with a sudden onset of palpitations and lightheadedness. On examination, her heart rate is 200 beats per minute, regular, and there are no abnormal findings on cardiac auscultation. An ECG is performed, which shows a regular narrow-complex tachycardia. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 75-year-old male with a history of hypertension and diabetes presents to the emergency department with a productive cough, fever, and confusion. On examination, his temperature is 101.8°F (38.8°C), blood pressure is 160/90 mm Hg, heart rate is 105 bpm, respiratory rate is 28 breaths per minute, and oxygen saturation is 91% on room air. He is disoriented and unable to follow simple commands. What is the CURB-65 score for this patient?

A 40-year-old female presents with complaints of fatigue, cold intolerance, constipation, and unexplained weight gain over the past several months. On physical examination, you note dry skin, bradycardia, and hair thinning. Laboratory tests reveal elevated thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) levels and low free thyroxine (T4) levels. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male with chronic kidney disease presents to the emergency department with muscle weakness and palpitations. An ECG reveals peaked T-waves. His serum potassium level is 6.5 mEq/L. What is the initial treatment of choice for this patient's hyperkalemia?
False about surgical site infection (SSI)?

options.label: A
options.text: Can occur only up to 14 days of surgery

options.label: B
options.text: In case of implants, can occur upto 1 year of surgery

options.label: D
options.text: Clean shaving of surgical site one day before surgery has no roloe in prevention of SSIs

questions.correct_answer: A. Can occur only up to 14 days of surgery

questions.text: Which suture material do not lose their tensile strength over time?

options.label: A
options.text: Mixed polymicrobial flora is most commonly seen

options.label: B
options.text: Most commonly seen in ascites in cirrhotic patients

options.label: C
options.text: May be associated with rupture of appendiceal abscess

questions.correct_answer: B. Most commonly seen in ascites in cirrhotic patients

questions.text: A victim of blunt abdominal trauma requires a partial hepatectomy. He is rapidly transfused with 8 units of appropriately crossmatched packed red blood cells from the blood bank. He is noted in the recovery room to be bleeding from intravenous puncture sites and the surgical incision. His coagulopathy is likely due to thrombocytopenia and deficiencies of which clotting factors?
Following laparotomy, normal bowel motility can ordinarily be presumed to have returned

options.label: A
options.text: In the stomach in 4 h, the small bowel and the colon after the first oral intake

options.label: B
options.text: In the stomach in 24 h, the small bowel in 4 h, and the colon in 3 days

options.label: C
options.text: In the stomach in 3 days, the small bowel in 3 days, and the colon in 3 days

options.label: D
options.text: In the stomach in 24 h, the small bowel in 24 h, and the colon in 24 h

questions.correct_answer: B. In the stomach in 24 h, the small bowel in 4 h, and the colon in 3 days

questions.text: An elderly diabetic woman with chronic steroid-dependent bronchospasm has an ileocolectomy for a perforated cecum. She is taken to the ICU intubated and is maintained on broad-spectrum antibiotics, renal-dose dopamine, and a rapid steroid taper. On postoperative day 2 she develops a fever of 39.2°C (102.5°F), hypotension, lethargy, and laboratory values remarkable for hypoglycemia and hyperkalemia. The most likely diagnosis of this acute event is?
A 26-year-old man sustains a gunshot wound to the left thigh. Exploration reveals that a 5-cm portion of superficial femoral artery is destroyed. Appropriate management includes

options.label: B
options.text: Debridement and repair with an interposition prosthetic graft

options.label: C
options.text: Debridement and repair with an interposition arterial graft

options.label: D
options.text: Debridement and repair with an interposition vein graft

questions.correct_answer: D. Debridement and repair with an interposition vein graft

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding hyperacute rejection of a transplanted kidney is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It is mediated by preformed donor antibodies against recipient HLA antigens

options.label: B
options.text: It can be prevented by performing lymphocytotoxicity cross-match testing

options.label: C
options.text: It is manifest grossly by a swollen, pale kidney at the time of transplant surgery

options.label: D
options.text: This form of rejection is associated with disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC)

questions.correct_answer: C. It is manifest grossly by a swollen, pale kidney at the time of transplant surgery

questions.text: The diagnosis of primary hyperparathyroidism is most strongly suggested by
questions.correct_answer: B. Serum alkaline phosphatase above 120 IU/L

questions.text: A 1 year old child presented with recurrent crying and red currant jelly stool. On examination a sausage shaped lump was found in epigastrium. All of the following are true statements regarding this condition except?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common cause of intestinal obstruction in young children

options.label: C
options.text: Appendix is most common leading point

options.label: D
options.text: Air and barium enema helpful in reduction

questions.correct_answer: C. Appendix is most common leading point

questions.text: False statement about thyroid is?

options.label: A

options.text: IOC for a thyroid nodule with high T3, T4 and low TSH is thyroid scan

options.text: FNAC should be ordered in any thyroid nodule with euthyroid status having size more than 1 cm and is taller than wider

options.label: D

questions.text: A 60 year old lady with metastatic breast cancer was treat by radiotherapy (30 gray) to left hip. RT course was uneventful. After 2 weeks of RT Doxorubicin chemo was started. questions.correct_answer: A. PCNL through upper posterior calyx

questions.text: During laparoscopy for undescended testis, a hypoplastic, reddish brown testicular nubbin was found. What is the next best step?

A 53-year-old woman with end-stage renal disease who was undergoing hemodialysis presented with fever, painful finger necrosis, and non-healing ulceration of the legs. X ray hand showed no evidence of osteomyelitis but did show severely calcified arteries and the loss of soft tissue at the tips of the index and middle fingers (visible in the image, along with an intravenous catheter at the wrist). Which of the following statement is consistent with the diagnosis of this case?

options.label: A
options.text: This is caused by high value of Calcium and phosphate in blood

options.label: B
options.text: This condition is due to high level of calcitonin in blood

options.label: C
options.text: The diagnosis is consistent with Primary hyperparathyroidism

options.label: D
options.text: Warfarin can help is controlling this condition.

questions.correct_answer: A. This is caused by high value of Calcium and phosphate in blood

questions.text: While performing laparoscopic appendicectomy on a 22 year old female, the surgeon noted that the liver of the patient was black. Her post-operative course was uneventful. Cutting has more voltage than coagulation C. Burns occur at the site of patient plate if conductive jelly not applied D. Pulsed wave current used for cutting E. Bipolar cautery is used only to coagulate bleeding points, not for cutting

If a test has 98% sensitivity, and the result comes out to be negative. This means:

options.label: A
options.text: Needs further evaluation with the test of similar spectrum.

options.label: B
options.text: Results should be discarded due to false negativity.

options.label: C
options.text: Disease has 2% prevalence in the population.

options.label: D
options.text: Disease can safely be ruled out.

questions.correct_answer: D. Disease can safely be ruled out.

questions.text: A study was done to assess the effect of age, gender, residence type and education on chances of having blindness. The results obtained were shown as below: 1. People in rural areas were less likely to develop blindness. 2. Illiterate people were more likely to develop blindness. 3. Elderly people are more likely to develop blindness. 4.   • • 1 dose of HRIG is given with dose of 20 IU/ kg

questions.text: As per Anaemia Mukt Bharat, what is the treatment for a primi 34 weeks with mild to moderate anaemia?

options.label: A
options.text: Injection ferric carboxy maltose if not tolerating oral iron

options.label: B
options.text: 2 tablets of oral iron/ folic acid + iron sucrose

options.label: D
options.text: Injection iron sucrose if not tolerating oral iron.

questions.correct_answer: D. Injection iron sucrose if not tolerating oral iron.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • Periodicity: At every ANC visit
  • • • Mild to Moderate anaemia (Hb 7- 10.9):
  • • • Management: IFA (BD) or IVIS (for poor compliance patients or those in late months of gestation)
  • • • Follow up: every 2 months
  • • • If no improvement (Hb < 1g/ dL increase) after 1 month of treatment; refer to FRU/ DH
  • • • Severe anaemia (Hb 5- 6.9): done by Dr. at PHC/ FRU/ DH by IVIS

questions.text: The attributable risk calculated for smoking and lung cancer is 95%. Identify the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence among exposed – Incidence among non-exposed

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence in total population – Incidence in non-exposed

options.label: C
options.text: If smoking is eliminated as risk factor there will be 95% reduction in annual incidence of lung cancer cases among the non-exposed

options.label: D
options.text: If smoking is eliminated as risk factor there will be 95% reduction in annual incidence of lung cancer cases among the population

questions.correct_answer: A. Incidence among exposed – Incidence among non-exposed
